title: China rules solar energy, but its industry at home is in trouble
description: SUMMARY1: Over the past 15 years, China's solar industry has faced upheaval despite dominating the global market. Plummeting prices and overcapacity led to massive losses, forcing many companies to cut costs drastically. Beijing's industrial policies, extensive support, and willingness to let companies fail highlight the chaotic landscape. Struggling firms and disappearing subsidies reflect the challenges in China's solar sector.
